cards.name: Hidden Ancients
cards.text: When an opponent casts an enchantment spell, if Hidden Ancients is an enchantment, Hidden Ancients becomes a 5/5 Treefolk creature.
cards.flavor: The only alert the invaders had was the rustling of leaves on a day without wind.

rulings.text: When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
It changes into a creature even if the spell is countered.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: When one of your opponents successfully casts an enchantment spell, if Hidden Ancients is an enchantment, Hidden Ancients becomes a 5/5 creature that counts as a Treefolk.

cards.name: Hidden Guerrillas
cards.text: When an opponent casts an artifact spell, if Hidden Guerrillas is an enchantment, Hidden Guerrillas becomes a 5/3 Soldier creature with trample.

rulings.text: When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
It changes into a creature even if the spell is countered.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: When one of your opponents successfully casts an artifact spell, if Hidden Guerrillas is an enchantment, Hidden Guerrillas becomes a 5/3 creature with trample and that counts as a Soldier.

cards.name: Hidden Herd
cards.text: When an opponent plays a nonbasic land, if Hidden Herd is an enchantment, Hidden Herd becomes a 3/3 Beast creature.

rulings.text: When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
Does not trigger on lands put onto the battlefield by a spell or ability.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: When one of your opponents plays a nonbasic land, if Hidden Herd is an enchantment, Hidden Herd becomes a 3/3 creature that counts as a Beast.

cards.name: Hidden Predators
cards.text: When an opponent controls a creature with power 4 or greater, if Hidden Predators is an enchantment, Hidden Predators becomes a 4/4 Beast creature.

rulings.text: When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: When one of your opponents controls a creature with power 4 or greater, if Hidden Predators is an enchantment, Hidden Predators becomes a 4/4 creature that counts as a Beast.

cards.name: Hidden Spider
cards.text: When an opponent casts a creature spell with flying, if Hidden Spider is an enchantment, Hidden Spider becomes a 3/5 Spider creature with reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It wants only to dress you in silk.

rulings.text: When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.
The ability only triggers if the creature spell has flying, regardless of whether an effect would cause the creature to have flying once it entered the battlefield.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: When one of your opponents successfully casts a creature with flying, if Hidden Spider is an enchantment, Hidden Spider becomes a 3/5 creature that can block creatures with flying and that counts as a Spider.

cards.name: Hidden Stag
cards.text:
Whenever an opponent plays a land, if Hidden Stag is an enchantment, Hidden Stag becomes a 3/2 Elk Beast creature.
Whenever you play a land, if Hidden Stag is a creature, Hidden Stag becomes an enchantment.

rulings.text: When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
Does not trigger on lands put onto the battlefield by a spell or ability.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText:
Whenever one of your opponents plays a land, if Hidden Stag is an enchantment, Hidden Stag becomes a 3/2 creature that counts as a Beast.
Whenever you play a land, if Hidden Stag is a creature, Hidden Stag becomes an enchantment.

cards.name: Hush
cards.text:
Destroy all enchantments.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Destroy all enchantments.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

cards.name: Lull
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Creatures deal no combat damage this turn.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

cards.name: Midsummer Revel
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Midsummer Revel.
{G}, Sacrifice Midsummer Revel: Create X 3/3 green Beast creature tokens, where X is the number of verse counters on Midsummer Revel.

rulings.text: Adding a counter is optional. If you forget to add one during your upkeep, you cannot back up and add one later.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Midsummer Revel.
{G}, Sacrifice Midsummer Revel: Put X Beast tokens into play, where X is the number of verse counters on Midsummer Revel. Treat these tokens as 3/3 green creatures.

cards.name: Pouncing Jaguar
cards.text: Echo {G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor: One pounce, she's hungry—you die quickly. Two, she's teaching her cubs—you're in for a long day.
cards.originalText: Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)

cards.name: Priest of Titania
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} for each Elf on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Titania rewards all those who honor the forest by making them a living part of it.

rulings.text: Since it is an Elf, it counts itself.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each Elf in play. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Rejuvenate
cards.text:
You gain 6 life.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Gain 6 life.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

cards.name: Retaliation
cards.text: Creatures you control have "Whenever this creature becomes blocked by a creature, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."
cards.flavor: A foul, metallic stench clogged Urza's senses. It was then he knew his brother was no more.
cards.originalText: Each creature you control gains "Whenever a creature blocks it, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."

cards.name: Sporogenesis
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fungus counter on target nontoken creature.
Whenever a creature with a fungus counter on it dies, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each fungus counter on that creature.
When Sporogenesis leaves the battlefield, remove all fungus counters from all creatures.

rulings.text: If a non-creature with fungus counters on it leaves the battlefield, there is no effect.

If more than one Sporogenesis is on the battlefield and a creature with fungus counters on it leaves the battlefield, each Sporogenesis will put a Saproling onto the battlefield for each counter. In other words if there are N copies of Sporogenesis and the creature had M fungus counters, you get N * M Saprolings.
If one Sporogenesis leaves the battlefield, all fungus counters are removed even if other Sporogenesis cards are on the battlefield.
Adding a counter is optional. If you forget to add one during your upkeep, you cannot back up and add one later.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a fungus counter on target nontoken creature.
Whenever a creature with a fungus counter on it is put into a graveyard, put a Saproling token into play for each of those fungus counters. Treat these tokens as 1/1 green creatures.
When Sporogenesis leaves play, remove all fungus counters from all creatures.

cards.name: Spreading Algae
cards.text:
Enchant Swamp
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.
When Spreading Algae is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Spreading Algae to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: This card now has Enchant Swamp, which works exactly like any other Enchant ability. This means it can only be cast targeting a Swamp, and it will be put into its owner's graveyard if the permanent it's attached to ever stops being a Swamp.

cards.originalText:
Play Spreading Algae only on a swamp. 
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy that land.
When Spreading Algae is put into a graveyard from play, return Spreading Algae to owner's hand.

cards.name: Symbiosis
cards.text: Two target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Although the elves of Argoth always considered them a nuisance, the pixies made fine allies during the war against the machines.
cards.originalText: Two target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Titania's Boon
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
cards.flavor: When the winds rock the trees, listen for voices in the creaking of the trunks. If you hear your name, you are one of the Goddess's chosen.
cards.originalText: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.name: Titania's Chosen
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Titania's Chosen.
cards.flavor:
"What do a hero and an arrow have in common? In times of war are many more made."
—Elvish riddle
cards.originalText: Whenever a player successfully casts a green spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Titania's Chosen.

cards.name: Treefolk Seedlings
cards.text: Treefolk Seedlings's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.
cards.flavor: The year that the brothers landed on Argoth, the trees produced five times as many seeds as normal.

rulings.text: The toughness is continuously calculated.

cards.originalText: Treefolk Seedlings has toughness equal to the number of forests you control.

cards.name: Treetop Rangers
cards.text: Treetop Rangers can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"If you can't catch them, cut the trees down from beneath them. Force them to fight on our terms."
—Mishra

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block this.

cards.originalText: Treetop Rangers cannot be blocked except by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Venomous Fangs
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a creature, destroy the other creature.
cards.flavor: All the pain of the shattered forest contained in a single drop.

rulings.text: If the damaged creature takes both lethal damage and is destroyed by this effect, you have to regenerate the creature twice to keep it alive.

cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature successfully deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature.

cards.name: Vernal Bloom
cards.text: Whenever a Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.
cards.flavor: Many cultures have legends of a lush, hidden paradise. The elves of Argoth had no need of such stories.

rulings.text: This is a triggered mana ability. It does not go on the stack.

cards.originalText: Whenever a forest is tapped for mana, it produces an additional {G}.

cards.name: War Dance
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on War Dance.
Sacrifice War Dance: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of verse counters on War Dance.

rulings.text: Adding a counter is optional. If you forget to add one during your upkeep, you cannot back up and add one later.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on War Dance.
Sacrifice War Dance: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of verse counters on War Dance.

cards.name: Whirlwind
cards.text: Destroy all creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: Urza tried to rule the air, but Gaea taught him that she controlled all the elements.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures with flying.

cards.name: Wild Dogs
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Wild Dogs.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, if a player has more life than any other, that player gains control of Wild Dogs.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

cards.name: Winding Wurm
cards.text: Echo {4}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor: Entire trees were stripped of their bark and branches by the wurm's writhing path.
cards.originalText: Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)

cards.name: Barrin's Codex
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a page counter on Barrin's Codex.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice Barrin's Codex: Draw X cards, where X is the number of page counters on Barrin's Codex.

rulings.text: Adding a counter is optional. If you forget to add one during your upkeep, you cannot back up and add one later.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a page counter on Barrin's Codex.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice Barrin's Codex: Draw X cards, where X is the number of page counters on Barrin's Codex.

cards.name: Cathodion
cards.text: When Cathodion dies, add {C}{C}{C}.
cards.flavor: Instead of creating a tool that would be damaged by heat, the Thran built one that was charged by it.

rulings.text: The ability is never a mana ability.
You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don't spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).

cards.originalText: When Cathodion is put into a graveyard from play, add three colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Chimeric Staff
cards.text: {X}: Chimeric Staff becomes an X/X Construct artifact creature until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A snake in the grasp.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

If Chimeric Staff is already an artifact creature when you activate its ability, Chimeric Staff stays an artifact creature but the ability resets its creature types. You always apply the effect from this card before counters or other effects that modify power and toughness. For example, if you pay {3} to make it a 3/3, then someone gives it -1/-1, it will be a 2/2. If you then activate the ability with {4}, you will apply the "4/4" effect before the -1/-1 effect, so the end result will be a 3/3. Damage that was dealt to the creature stays on it.

cards.originalText: {X}: Chimeric Staff is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to X until end of turn.

cards.name: Citanul Flute
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost X or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: X can be zero if you want.
You look in your library but you do not have to choose a creature even if you have one that meets the criteria.

cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Search your library for a creature card with total casting cost no greater than X. Reveal that card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your library afterward.

cards.name: Claws of Gix
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a permanent: You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: When the Brotherhood of Gix dug out the cave of Koilos they found their master's severed hand. They enshrined it, hoping that one day it would point the way to Phyrexia.
cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice a permanent: Gain 1 life.

cards.name: Copper Gnomes
cards.text: {4}, Sacrifice Copper Gnomes: You may put an artifact card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Start with eleven gnomes and a room of parts, and come morning you'll have ten and a monster the likes of which you've never seen.

rulings.text: You choose the artifact card on resolution.
Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.originalText: {4}, Sacrifice Copper Gnomes: Choose an artifact card in your hand and put that artifact into play.

cards.name: Crystal Chimes
cards.text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice Crystal Chimes: Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: As Serra was to learn, the peace and sanctity of her realm were as fragile as glass.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice Crystal Chimes: Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Dragon Blood
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: Fire in the blood, fire in the belly.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Endoskeleton
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Endoskeleton during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+3 for as long as Endoskeleton remains tapped.
cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Endoskeleton during your untap phase.
{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+3 as long as Endoskeleton remains tapped.

cards.name: Fluctuator
cards.text: Cycling abilities you activate cost up to {2} less to activate.
cards.flavor: Fiko summoned only atogs for three straight sessions. The tutor couldn't decide whether to punish his failure or praise his consistency.
cards.originalText: Cycling costs you up to {2} less to play.

cards.name: Grafted Skullcap
cards.text:
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.
At the beginning of your end step, discard your hand.
cards.flavor:
"Let go your mind. Mine is fitter."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor
cards.originalText:
During your draw phase, draw an additional card.
At the end of each of your turns, discard your hand.

cards.name: Hopping Automaton
cards.text: {0}: Hopping Automaton gets -1/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Designed to carry equipment across rivers, the hopping automaton was soon pressed into service in the infantry.
cards.originalText: {0}: Hopping Automaton gets -1/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Karn, Silver Golem
cards.text:
Whenever Karn, Silver Golem blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -4/+4 until end of turn.
{1}: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn.

rulings.text: The blocking ability triggers only once no matter how many blockers are declared.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText:
Whenever Karn, Silver Golem blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -4/+4 until end of turn.
{1}: Target noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its casting cost until end of turn. (That artifact retains its abilities.)

cards.name: Lifeline
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, if another creature is on the battlefield, return the first card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: It fails to bring the creature back if the creature is not still in the graveyard at the end of turn.
It works for all players and has errata to remove the "your graveyard" text.
The creature comes back even if Lifeline leaves the battlefield after triggering, but before it resolves.
If multiple creatures are coming back, they come back one at a time, not all at once. This is because Lifeline triggered once for each creature and set up a separate "at end of turn" effect for each.

If more than one creature is on the battlefield and all the creatures on the battlefield go to the graveyard at once, then none of them are returned at end of turn. This is because Lifeline's ability has an intervening-if clause, which means that there must be at least one creature on the battlefield at the time the ability resolves.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard and a creature is in play, return that creature from your graveyard to play at end of turn.

cards.name: Lotus Blossom
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a petal counter on Lotus Blossom.
{T}, Sacrifice Lotus Blossom: Add X mana of any one color, where X is the number of petal counters on Lotus Blossom.

rulings.text: Adding a counter is optional. If you forget to add one during your upkeep, you cannot back up and add one later.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a petal counter on Lotus Blossom.
{T}, Sacrifice Lotus Blossom: Add X mana of one color to your mana pool, where X is the number of petal counters on Lotus Blossom. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Metrognome
cards.text:
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Metrognome, create four 1/1 colorless Gnome artifact creature tokens.
{4}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Gnome artifact creature token.
cards.originalText:
When a spell or ability one of your opponents controls causes you to discard Metrognome, put four Gnome tokens into play. Treat these tokens as 1/1 artifact creatures.
{4}, {T}: Put a Gnome token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 artifact creature.

cards.name: Mishra's Helix
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Tap X target lands.
cards.flavor: The helix was the finest example of Mishra's campaign strategy: if he couldn't have Argoth, no one could.

rulings.text: You can target already tapped lands.

cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Tap X lands.

cards.name: Mobile Fort
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{3}: Mobile Fort gets +3/-1 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.originalText:
Mobile Fort counts as a Wall. (Walls cannot attack.)
{3}: Mobile Fort gets +3/-1 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it were not a Wall. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Noetic Scales
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, return to its owner's hand each creature that player controls with power greater than the number of cards in their hand.

rulings.text: The number of cards in hand is counted on resolution of the ability.

cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, return to owner's hand each creature that player controls with power greater than the number of cards in his or her hand.

cards.name: Phyrexian Colossus
cards.text:
Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step.
Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.
Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.
cards.originalText:
Phyrexian Colossus does not untap during your untap phase.
Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.
Phyrexian Colossus cannot be blocked by fewer than three creatures.

cards.name: Phyrexian Processor
cards.text:
As Phyrexian Processor enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life.
{4}, {T}: Create an X/X black Minion creature token, where X is the life paid as Phyrexian Processor entered the battlefield.

rulings.text: You can pay 0 life if you want, but it's not useful most of the time.

cards.originalText:
When Phyrexian Processor comes into play, pay any amount of life.
{4}, {T}: Put a Minion token into play. Treat this token as a black creature with power and toughness each equal to the amount of life paid at the time Phyrexian Processor came into play.

cards.name: Pit Trap
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Pit Trap: Destroy target attacking creature without flying. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Yotian soldiers were designed to fight, not watch their feet.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Pit Trap: Destroy target attacking creature without flying. That creature cannot be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Purging Scythe
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Purging Scythe deals 2 damage to the creature with the least toughness. If two or more creatures are tied for least toughness, you choose one of them.

rulings.text: Does not target the creature it damages.

cards.originalText: During your upkeep, Purging Scythe deals 2 damage to the creature with the lowest toughness. If two or more creatures are tied for the lowest toughness, you decide to which creature Purging Scythe deals damage.

cards.name: Smokestack
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a soot counter on Smokestack.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a permanent for each soot counter on Smokestack.

rulings.text: If a player does not have enough permanents, they sacrifice all the ones they have.
Adding a counter is optional. If you forget to add one during your upkeep, you cannot back up and add one later.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a soot counter on Smokestack.
During each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a permanent for each soot counter on Smokestack.

cards.name: Temporal Aperture
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Shuffle your library, then reveal the top card. Until end of turn, for as long as that card remains on top of your library, play with the top card of your library revealed and you may play that card without paying its mana cost. (If it has X in its mana cost, X is 0.)

rulings.text: While you do not have to pay the mana cost, you do have to pay any other costs described in the text that are paid when playing the card. If the cost in the card text is optional, such as with Buyback, you can optionally pay that cost.
If your library is shuffled or that card otherwise leaves the top of your library, the effect ends.
The card is removed from the top of the library when you play it, just like a card is removed from your hand when you play it.

cards.originalText: {5}, {T}: Shuffle your library and reveal the top card. Until end of turn, as long as that card remains on top of your library, you may play the card as though it were in your hand without paying its casting cost. (If the spell has {X} in its casting cost, X is 0.)

cards.name: Thran Turbine
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may add {C}{C}. You can't spend this mana to cast spells.
cards.flavor: When Urza asked the viashino what it did, they answered: "It hums."

rulings.text: Any of this mana that isn't spent during your upkeep step will be removed before your draw step begins. You cannot save it to be spent on the card you will draw this turn.

cards.originalText: During your upkeep, you may add up to two colorless mana to your mana pool. This mana cannot be spent to play spells.

cards.name: Umbilicus
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns a permanent they control to its owner's hand unless they pay 2 life.
cards.flavor: It was the explorers' only tether to reality.

rulings.text: If you only have 1 life, you can't choose the pay 2 life option.
If you don't have a permanent to choose, you can still choose to not pay the life and then just do nothing since there is no permanent to choose.
You choose to pay the life or not pay the life during the resolution of the ability.

cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, that player pays 2 life or returns a permanent he or she controls to owner's hand.

cards.name: Urza's Armor
cards.text: If a source would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
cards.flavor:
"Tawnos's blueprints were critical to the creation of my armor. As he once sealed himself in steel, I sealed myself in a walking crypt."
—Urza

rulings.text: If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect, and prevent the 1 damage to you only.
It is a prevention effect applied when damage would be dealt.

cards.originalText: Whenever a source deals damage to you, that damage is reduced by 1.

cards.name: Voltaic Key
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Untap target artifact.
cards.flavor: The key did not work on a single lock, yet it opened many doors.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Untap target artifact.

cards.name: Wall of Junk
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Wall of Junk blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
cards.flavor: Urza saw the wall and realized that even if he tore every Phyrexian to pieces, they would still resist him.

rulings.text: It only returns to owner's hand if it is still on the battlefield at end of combat.

cards.originalText: Whenever Wall of Junk blocks, return it to owner's hand at end of combat.

cards.name: Whetstone
cards.text: {3}: Each player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
To hone swords and dull minds.
—Whetstone inscription

rulings.text: Can be used if a player has less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, each affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

cards.originalText: {3}: Each player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Wirecat
cards.text: Wirecat can't attack or block if an enchantment is on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Its purr is the sound of iron filings sliding down satin.
cards.originalText: Wirecat cannot attack or block if an enchantment is in play.

cards.originalText:

{T}: Add two colorless mana to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.text:
Flash
Protection from red
cards.flavor: "It is not my place to question Radiant's rule. I exist to enforce her will."

Protection from red
You may play Defender of Law any time you could play an instant.

cards.name: Devout Harpist
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature.
cards.flavor: The notes themselves are irrelevant. The music's effect, however, is worth ten armies.

rulings.text: It can only target "Enchantment - Aura" cards, which includes cards changed into Auras, such as Licids.
